content: Your subscription remains active, but we recommend contacting the {{productName}} owner to choose a new Payer.

comment.text: This translation key displays a message to an admin user when their subscription is active but their email address is invalid. It prompts the admin to contact the product owner to choose a new payer. This text appears in the Payer Information Container UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "دافع جديد" (dafi' jadeed) translates to 'new payer' but a more natural translation for 'choose a new Payer' would be something along the lines of "اختيار دافع بديل" (ikhtiyar dafi' badeel) or "تحديد دافع بديل" (tahdeed dafi' badeel). The current translation sounds somewhat awkward in Arabic.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: اشتراكك ما زال نشطًا، ولكن نوصي بالاتصال بمالك {{productName}} لتحديد دافع بديل.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Ödəyici' is a valid translation for 'Payer,' but might not be the most natural or commonly used term in Azerbaijani in this context. A more user-friendly option might be 'ödəmə edən' or 'müştəri'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'ödəmə edən' or 'müştəri' instead of 'Ödəyici' for improved clarity and naturalness.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "新しい支払人を選択するために" (new payer selection for) is a bit awkward. While technically correct, it's not the most natural way to express the recommendation in Japanese. It would be more natural to say something like "新しい支払い元を選択してもらうために" (to have the new payer selected).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 新しい支払い元を選択してもらうために

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the product name variable {{productName}} is slightly awkward in the Japanese sentence. While it functions, a more natural flow might benefit from placement adjustments, although its functionality is maintained.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 新しい支払い元を選択してもらうために、{{productName}}の所有者に連絡することをお勧めします。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "새로운 지불자를 선택할 것을 추천드립니다" is a bit formal and doesn't flow naturally. A more conversational and direct translation would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 새로운 결제 담당자를 선택하시는 것을 권장합니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the use of "~를 권장합니다" is a bit stiff.  Consider a more casual phrasing for better user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 새로운 결제 담당자를 선택해 보시는 것을 추천합니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ເຮົາແນະນຳ" (we recommend) is a bit formal for this context. A more conversational tone might be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ປ່ຽນເປັນ "ພວກເຂົາເຕືອນວ່າ" or "ພວກເຂົາແນະນໍາວ່າ" - "They advise that" or similar, or a more direct suggestion like "ພວກເຂົາບອກວ່າ" (They say).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ເຈົ້າຂອງ' (owner) feels slightly unnatural when referring to a product/service subscription. It's more of a 'manager' or 'administrator' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'ຜູ້ປົກຄອງ' (administrator) or 'ຜູ້ບໍລິຫານ' (manager) instead of 'ເຈົ້າຂອງ'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Payer" is not accurately translated in Portuguese. "Pagador" typically refers to someone who makes payments, not necessarily the administrator of the subscription or the entity responsible for managing the subscription.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more accurate translation like "administrador do {{productName}}" or "responsável pelo {{productName}}" to better convey the meaning of 'Payer' in this context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Pagador' while technically meaning 'payer,' can sound a bit formal or awkward in this context. A more natural and common word in Brazilian Portuguese for 'payer' in a subscription context would be 'responsável' or 'titular'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sua assinatura permanece ativa, mas recomendamos entrar em contato com o proprietário do {{productName}} para escolher um novo responsável.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Payer' (Plătitor) doesn't perfectly align with the intended meaning of 'owner' in the context of a subscription. It implies the person making the payment, not the administrator or account holder who can change payment methods.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Abonamentul dvs. rămâne activ, dar vă recomandăm să contactați administratorul {{productName}} pentru a alege un nou Plătitor.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While minor, using a period (.) after 'Plătitor' would improve readability. It is common practice in Romanian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Abonamentul dvs. rămâne activ, dar vă recomandăm să contactați administratorul {{productName}} pentru a alege un nou Plătitor.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "නව ගෙවන්නෙකු තේරීම සඳහා" (for choosing a new payer) is a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would convey the meaning of 'selecting' or 'designating' a new payer.

While technically correct, "හිමිකරු ඇමතීමට නිර්දේශ කෙරේ" (it is recommended to call the owner) can be perceived as too direct. A softer phrasing would be more polite and appropriate for customer communication.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: හිමිකරුගෙන් සම්බන්ධ කර ගැනීම වඩා හොඳයි

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'Platioца' is an unusual and potentially incorrect translation of 'Payer' in this context. It sounds awkward and doesn't convey the intended meaning of someone who makes payments.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'Наплатиоца' or a more common term like 'понуђача услуге плаћања' (payment service provider), or simply 'плаћаоца' depending on the overall tone and target audience.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Ödeme Yapan' is not the best translation for 'Payer'. A more natural and accurate translation would be 'ödeme yapan kişi' or simply 'ödeme sorumlusu'. 'Ödeme Yapan' sounds unnatural and potentially confusing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Aboneliğiniz etkin kalır fakat yeni bir ödeme sorumlusu seçmek için {{productName}} sahibiyle iletişime geçmenizi öneririz.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Gói dịch vụ đăng ký" is overly literal for 'subscription'. A more natural translation would be something like 'Đăng ký' or 'Tài khoản'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Gói đăng ký của bạn vẫn hiệu lực, hoặc Đăng ký của bạn vẫn hiệu lực.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: “Người trả phí” is a very literal translation of 'Payer'. A more natural translation in Vietnamese would be 'người thanh toán' or 'chủ tài khoản thanh toán'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: chúng tôi khuyên bạn nên liên hệ với chủ sở hữu {{productName}} để chọn người thanh toán mới.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "payer" is not ideal. "付款人" literally translates to "payer" but in this context, it sounds overly formal and doesn't quite convey the intended meaning of someone who manages payments or billing. A more natural and understandable translation might be "账单负责人" (zhàngdān fùzé rén) - billing manager/responsible person.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing "付款人" with "账单负责人" (zhàngdān fùzé rén) or a similar phrase that conveys the intended meaning of someone managing payments.
